014package org.jdbi.v3.core.statement;

017import java.io.Reader;
018import java.lang.reflect.Type;
019import java.math.BigDecimal;
020import java.net.URI;
021import java.net.URL;
022import java.sql.Blob;
023import java.sql.Clob;
024import java.sql.PreparedStatement;
025import java.sql.SQLException;
026import java.sql.Time;
027import java.sql.Timestamp;
028import java.util.Arrays;
029import java.util.Iterator;
030import java.util.List;
031import java.util.Map;
032import java.util.Objects;
033import java.util.UUID;
034import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
035import java.util.function.Consumer;
036import java.util.function.Supplier;
037import java.util.stream.Stream;
038
039import org.jdbi.v3.core.Handle;
040import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.Argument;
041import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.BeanPropertyArguments;
042import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.CharacterStreamArgument;
043import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.InputStreamArgument;
044import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.NamedArgumentFinder;
045import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.NullArgument;
046import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.ObjectArgument;
047import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.ObjectFieldArguments;
048import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.ObjectMethodArguments;
049import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.internal.NamedArgumentFinderFactory;
050import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.internal.PojoPropertyArguments;
051import org.jdbi.v3.core.generic.GenericType;
052import org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.IterableLike;
053import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.Mappers;
054import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.RowMapper;
055import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.immutables.JdbiImmutables;
056import org.jdbi.v3.core.qualifier.NVarchar;
057import org.jdbi.v3.core.qualifier.QualifiedType;
058import org.jdbi.v3.meta.Beta;
059
060import static java.util.stream.Collectors.joining;
061
062import static org.jdbi.v3.core.generic.GenericTypes.arrayType;
063import static org.jdbi.v3.core.generic.GenericTypes.parameterizeClass;
064
065/**
066 * This class provides the common functions between <code>Query</code> and
067 * <code>Update</code>. It defines most of the argument binding functions
068 * used by its subclasses.
069 */
070@SuppressWarnings({"deprecation", "PMD.ExcessiveClassLength"})
071public abstract class SqlStatement<This extends SqlStatement<This>> extends BaseStatement<This> {
072    private final Handle handle;
073    private final String sql;
074    PreparedStatement stmt;
075
076    SqlStatement(Handle handle,
077                 CharSequence sql) {
078        super(handle);
079
080        this.handle = handle;
081        this.sql = sql.toString();
082
083        getContext()
084            .setConnection(handle.getConnection())
085            .setRawSql(this.sql);
086    }
087
088    protected Binding getBinding() {
089        return getContext().getBinding();
090    }
091
092    /**
093     * Returns the un-translated SQL used to create this statement.
094     *
095     * @return the un-translated SQL used to create this statement.
096     */
097    protected String getSql() {
098        return sql;
099    }
100
101    /**
102     * Set the query timeout, in seconds, on the prepared statement.
103     *
104     * @param seconds number of seconds before timing out
105     *
106     * @return the same Query instance
107     */
108    public This setQueryTimeout(final int seconds) {
109        return addCustomizer(StatementCustomizers.statementTimeout(seconds));
110    }
111
112    /**
113     * Transfer ownership of the handle to the statement: when the statement is closed,
114     * commit the handle's transaction (if one exists) and close the handle.
115     * @return this
116     */
117    public This cleanupHandleCommit() {
118        return cleanupHandle(Handle::commit);
119    }
120
121    /**
122     * When the statement is closed, roll it back then close the owning Handle.
123     * @return this
124     */
125    public This cleanupHandleRollback() {
126        return cleanupHandle(Handle::rollback);
127    }
128
129    private This cleanupHandle(Consumer<Handle> action) {
130        addCleanable(() -> {
131            if (handle != null) {
132                if (handle.isInTransaction()) {
133                    action.accept(handle);
134                }
135                handle.close();
136            }
137        });
138        return typedThis;
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Used if you need to have some exotic parameter bound.
143     *
144     * @param position position to bindBinaryStream this argument, starting at 0
145     * @param argument exotic argument factory
146     *
147     * @return the same Query instance
148     */
149    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
150    public This bind(int position, Argument argument) {
151        getBinding().addPositional(position, argument);
152        return (This) this;
153    }
154
155    /**
156     * Used if you need to have some exotic parameter bound.
157     *
158     * @param name     name to bindBinaryStream this argument
159     * @param argument exotic argument factory
160     *
161     * @return the same Query instance
162     */
163    public This bind(String name, Argument argument) {
164        getBinding().addNamed(name, argument);
165        return typedThis;
166    }
167
168    /**
169     * Binds named parameters from JavaBean properties on the argument.
170     *
171     * @param bean source of named parameter values to use as arguments
172     *
173     * @return modified statement
174     */
175    public This bindBean(Object bean) {
176        return bindBean(null, bean);
177    }
178
179    /**
180     * Binds named parameters from JavaBean properties on the bean argument, with the given prefix.
181     *
182     * Example: the prefix {@code foo} applied to a bean property {@code bar} will be bound as {@code foo.bar}.
183     *
184     * @param prefix a prefix to apply to all property names.
185     * @param bean source of named parameter values to use as arguments
186     *
187     * @return modified statement
188     */
189    public This bindBean(String prefix, Object bean) {
190        return bindNamedArgumentFinder(
191                NamedArgumentFinderFactory.BEAN,
192                prefix,
193                bean,
194                bean.getClass(),
195                () -> new BeanPropertyArguments(prefix, bean, getConfig()));
196    }
197
198    /**
199     * Binds named parameters from object properties on the argument.
200     * The type must have been registered with pojo type mapping functionality first, usually
201     * by a plugin or configuration.
202     *
203     * @param pojo source of named parameter values to use as arguments
204     *
205     * @return modified statement
206     * @see JdbiImmutables an example method of registering a type
207     */
208    @Beta
209    public This bindPojo(Object pojo) {
210        return bindPojo(null, pojo);
211    }
212
213    /**
214     * Binds named parameters from object properties on the bean argument, with the given prefix.
215     * The type must have been registered with pojo type mapping functionality first, usually
216     * by a plugin or configuration.
217     *
218     * @param prefix a prefix to apply to all property names.
219     * @param pojo source of named parameter values to use as arguments
220     *
221     * @return modified statement
222     * @see JdbiImmutables an example method of registering a type
223     */
224    @Beta
225    public This bindPojo(String prefix, Object pojo) {
226        return bindPojo(prefix, pojo, pojo.getClass());
227    }
228
229    /**
230     * Binds named parameters from object properties on the argument.
231     * The type must have been registered with pojo type mapping functionality first, usually
232     * by a plugin or configuration.
233     *
234     * @param pojo source of named parameter values to use as arguments
235     * @param type the static, possibly generic type of the pojo
236     *
237     * @return modified statement
238     * @see JdbiImmutables an example method of registering a type
239     */
240    @Beta
241    public This bindPojo(Object pojo, Type type) {
242        return bindPojo(null, pojo, type);
243    }
244
245    /**
246     * Binds named parameters from object properties on the bean argument, with the given prefix.
247     * The type must have been registered with pojo type mapping functionality first, usually
248     * by a plugin or configuration.
249     *
250     * @param prefix a prefix to apply to all property names.
251     * @param pojo source of named parameter values to use as arguments
252     * @param type the static, possibly generic type of the pojo
253     *
254     * @return modified statement
255     * @see JdbiImmutables an example method of registering a type
256     */
257    @Beta
258    public This bindPojo(String prefix, Object pojo, Type type) {
259        return bindNamedArgumentFinder(
260                NamedArgumentFinderFactory.POJO,
261                prefix,
262                pojo,
263                type,
264                () -> new PojoPropertyArguments(prefix, pojo, type, getConfig()));
265    }
266
267    /**
268     * Binds named parameters from object properties on the argument.
269     * The type must have been registered with pojo type mapping functionality first, usually
270     * by a plugin or configuration.
271     *
272     * @param pojo source of named parameter values to use as arguments
273     * @param type the static generic type of the pojo
274     *
275     * @return modified statement
276     * @see JdbiImmutables an example method of registering a type
277     */
278    @Beta
279    public This bindPojo(Object pojo, GenericType<?> type) {
280        return bindPojo(null, pojo, type.getType());
281    }
282
283    /**
284     * Binds named parameters from object properties on the bean argument, with the given prefix.
285     * The type must have been registered with pojo type mapping functionality first, usually
286     * by a plugin or configuration.
287     *
288     * @param prefix a prefix to apply to all property names.
289     * @param pojo source of named parameter values to use as arguments
290     * @param type the static generic type of the pojo
291     *
292     * @return modified statement
293     * @see JdbiImmutables an example method of registering a type
294     */
295    @Beta
296    public This bindPojo(String prefix, Object pojo, GenericType<?> type) {
297        return bindPojo(prefix, pojo, type.getType());
298    }
299
300    /**
301     * Binds public fields of the specified object as arguments for the query.
302     *
303     * @param object source of the public fields to bind.
304     *
305     * @return modified statement
306     */
307    public This bindFields(Object object) {
308        return bindFields(null, object);
309    }
310
311    /**
312     * Binds public fields of the specified object as arguments for the query.
313     *
314     * @param prefix a prefix to apply to all field names.
315     * @param object source of the public fields to bind.
316     *
317     * @return modified statement
318     */
319    public This bindFields(String prefix, Object object) {
320        return bindNamedArgumentFinder(
321                NamedArgumentFinderFactory.FIELDS,
322                prefix,
323                object,
324                object.getClass(),
325                () -> new ObjectFieldArguments(prefix, object));
326    }
327
328    /**
329     * Binds methods with no parameters on the argument.
330     *
331     * @param object source of methods to use as arguments
332     *
333     * @return modified statement
334     */
335    public This bindMethods(Object object) {
336        return bindMethods(null, object);
337    }
338
339    /**
340     * Binds methods with no parameters on the argument, with the given prefix.
341     *
342     * @param prefix a prefix to apply to all property names.
343     * @param object source of methods to use as arguments
344     *
345     * @return modified statement
346     */
347    public This bindMethods(String prefix, Object object) {
348        return bindNamedArgumentFinder(
349                NamedArgumentFinderFactory.METHODS,
350                prefix,
351                object,
352                object.getClass(),
353                () -> new ObjectMethodArguments(prefix, object));
354    }
355
356    /**
357     * Binds named parameters from a map of String to Object instances
358     *
359     * @param map map where keys are matched to named parameters in order to bind arguments.
360     *            Can be null, in which case the binding has no effect.
361     *
362     * @return modified statement
363     */
364    public This bindMap(Map<String, ?> map) {
365        if (map != null) {
366            map.forEach(this::bind);
367        }
368        return typedThis;
369    }
370
371    /**
372     * Binds a new {@link NamedArgumentFinder}.
373     *
374     * @param namedArgumentFinder A NamedArgumentFinder to bind. Can be null.
375     *
376     * @return the same Query instance
377     */
378    public This bindNamedArgumentFinder(final NamedArgumentFinder namedArgumentFinder) {
379        if (namedArgumentFinder != null) {
380            getBinding().addNamedArgumentFinder(namedArgumentFinder);
381        }
382
383        return typedThis;
384    }
385
386    This bindNamedArgumentFinder(
387            NamedArgumentFinderFactory factory,
388            String prefix,
389            Object value,
390            Type type,
391            Supplier<NamedArgumentFinder> namedArgumentFinder) {
392        return bindNamedArgumentFinder(namedArgumentFinder.get());
393    }
394
395    /**
396     * Bind an argument positionally
397     *
398     * @param position position to bind the parameter at, starting at 0
399     * @param value    to bind
400     *
401     * @return the same Query instance
402     */
403    public final This bind(int position, Character value) {
404        return bind(position, Character.class, value);
405    }
406
407    /**
408     * Bind an argument by name
409     *
410     * @param name  token name to bind the parameter to
411     * @param value to bind
412     *
413     * @return the same Query instance
414     */
415    public final This bind(String name, Character value) {
416        return bind(name, Character.class, value);
417    }
418
419    /**
420     * Bind an argument positionally
421     *
422     * @param position position to bind the parameter at, starting at 0
423     * @param value    to bind
424     *
425     * @return the same Query instance
426     */
427    public final This bind(int position, String value) {
428        return bind(position, String.class, value);
429    }
430
431    /**
432     * Bind an argument by name
433     *
434     * @param name  token name to bind the parameter to
435     * @param value to bind
436     *
437     * @return the same Query instance
438     */
439    public final This bind(String name, String value) {
440        return bind(name, String.class, value);
441    }
442
443    /**
444     * Bind a {@code String} argument positionally, as {@code NVARCHAR} type.
445     *
446     * @param position position to bind the parameter at, starting at 0
447     * @param value to bind
448     *
449     * @return the same Query instance
450     */
451    public final This bindNVarchar(int position, String value) {
452        return bindByType(position, value, QualifiedType.of(String.class).with(NVarchar.class));
453    }
454
455    /**
456     * Bind a {@code String} argument by name, as {@code NVARCHAR} type.
457     *
458     * @param name  token name to bind the parameter to
459     * @param value to bind
460     *
461     * @return the same Query instance
462     */
463    public final This bindNVarchar(String name, String value) {
464        return bindByType(name, value, QualifiedType.of(String.class).with(NVarchar.class));
465    }
466

468     * Bind an argument positionally
469     *
470     * @param position position to bind the parameter at, starting at 0
471     * @param value    to bind
472     *
473     * @return the same Query instance
474     */
475    public final This bind(int position, int value) {
476        return bind(position, int.class, value);
477    }

539    /**
540     * Bind an argument positionally
541     *
542     * @param position position to bind the parameter at, starting at 0
543     * @param value    to bind
544     * @param length   how long is the stream being bound?
545     *
546     * @return the same Query instance
547     */
548    public final This bindASCIIStream(int position, InputStream value, int length) {
549        return bind(position, new InputStreamArgument(value, length, true));
550    }
551
552    /**
553     * Bind an argument by name
554     *
555     * @param name   token name to bind the parameter to
556     * @param value  to bind
557     * @param length bytes to read from value
558     *
559     * @return the same Query instance
560     */
561    public final This bindASCIIStream(String name, InputStream value, int length) {
562        return bind(name, new InputStreamArgument(value, length, true));
563    }

588
589    /**
590     * Bind an argument positionally
591     *
592     * @param position position to bind the parameter at, starting at 0
593     * @param value    to bind
594     * @param length the number of bytes in the stream.
595     *
596     * @return the same Query instance
597     */
598    public final This bindBinaryStream(int position, InputStream value, int length) {
599        return bind(position, new InputStreamArgument(value, length, false));
600    }
601
602    /**
603     * Bind an argument by name
604     *
605     * @param name   token name to bind the parameter to
606     * @param value  to bind

609     * @return the same Query instance
610     */
611    public final This bindBinaryStream(String name, InputStream value, int length) {
612        return bind(name, new InputStreamArgument(value, length, false));
613    }

659    public final This bind(int position, Boolean value) {

662
663    private This bind(int position, Class<?> type, Object value) {
664        return bindByType(position, value, type);
665    }
666
667    private This bind(String name, Class<?> type, Object value) {
668        return bindByType(name, value, type);
669    }

767    /**
768     * Bind an argument positionally
769     *

777
778        return bind(position, new CharacterStreamArgument(value, length));
779    }
780
781    /**
782     * Bind an argument by name
783     *

793
794    /**
795     * Bind an argument positionally
796     *
797     * @param position position to bind the parameter at, starting at 0
798     * @param value    to bind
799     *
800     * @return the same Query instance
801     */
802    public final This bind(int position, Clob value) {
803        return bindByType(position, value, Clob.class);

1283
1284    /**
1285     * Bind a Java array as a SQL array.  Usually you can just {@link #bind(int, Object)} an array,
1286     * but this method allows varargs.
1287     * @param <T> the array element type
1288     * @param name the name of the parameter to bind
1289     * @param array the array to bind
1290     * @return this Query
1291     */
1292    @SafeVarargs
1293    public final <T> This bindArray(String name, T... array) {
1294        return bindArray(name, array.getClass().getComponentType(), array);
1295    }
1296
1297    /**
1298     * Bind a Java array as a SQL array.  Usually you can just {@link #bind(int, Object)} an array,
1299     * but this method allows varargs.
1300     * @param <T> the array element type
1301     * @param pos the position of the parameter to bind
1302     * @param array the array to bind
1303     * @return this Query
1304     */
1305    @SafeVarargs
1306    public final <T> This bindArray(int pos, T... array) {
1307        return bindArray(pos, array.getClass().getComponentType(), array);
1308    }
1309
1310    /**
1311     * Bind a Java array as a SQL array, casting each element to a new type.
1312     * @param name the name of the parameter to bind
1313     * @param elementType the array element type
1314     * @param array the array to bind
1315     * @return this Query
1316     */
1317    public final This bindArray(String name, Type elementType, Object... array) {
1318        return bindByType(name, array, arrayType(elementType));
1319    }
1320
1321    /**
1322     * Bind a Java array as a SQL array, casting each element to a new type.
1323     * @param pos the position of the parameter to bind
1324     * @param elementType the array element type
1325     * @param array the array to bind
1326     * @return this Query
1327     */
1328    public final This bindArray(int pos, Type elementType, Object... array) {
1329        return bindByType(pos, array, arrayType(elementType));
1330    }

1332    /**

1335     * @param elementType the element type of the Iterable
1336     * @param iterable the iterable to bind as an array
1337     * @return this Query
1338     */
1339    public final This bindArray(String name, Type elementType, Iterable<?> iterable) {
1340        return bindByType(name, iterable, parameterizeClass(Iterable.class, elementType));
1341    }

1376    /**
1377     * Bind NULL to be set for a given argument.
1378     *
1379     * @param name    Named parameter to bind to
1380     * @param sqlType The sqlType must be set and is a value from <code>java.sql.Types</code>
1381     *
1382     * @return the same statement instance
1383     */
1384    public final This bindNull(String name, int sqlType) {
1385        return bind(name, new NullArgument(sqlType));
1386    }
1387
1388    /**
1389     * Bind NULL to be set for a given argument.
1390     *
1391     * @param position position to bind NULL to, starting at 0
1392     * @param sqlType  The sqlType must be set and is a value from <code>java.sql.Types</code>
1393     *
1394     * @return the same statement instance
1395     */
1396    public final This bindNull(int position, int sqlType) {
1397        return bind(position, new NullArgument(sqlType));
1398    }
1399
1400    /**
1401     * Bind a value using a specific type from <code>java.sql.Types</code> via
1402     * PreparedStatement#setObject(int, Object, int)
1403     *
1404     * @param name    Named parameter to bind at
1405     * @param value   Value to bind
1406     * @param sqlType The sqlType from java.sql.Types
1407     *
1408     * @return self
1409     */
1410    public final This bindBySqlType(String name, Object value, int sqlType) {
1411        return bind(name, ObjectArgument.of(value, sqlType));
1412    }
1413
1414    /**
1415     * Bind a value using a specific type from <code>java.sql.Types</code> via
1416     * PreparedStatement#setObject(int, Object, int)
1417     *
1418     * @param position position to bind NULL to, starting at 0
1419     * @param value    Value to bind
1420     * @param sqlType  The sqlType from java.sql.Types
1421     *
1422     * @return self
1423     */
1424    public final This bindBySqlType(int position, Object value, int sqlType) {
1425        return bind(position, ObjectArgument.of(value, sqlType));
1426    }
1427
1428    /**
1429     * see {@link #bindList(BiConsumer, String, List)}
1430     *
1431     * @param key    attribute name
1432     * @param values vararg values that will be comma-spliced into the defined attribute value.
1433     * @return this
1434     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the vararg array is empty.
1435     */
1436    public final This bindList(String key, Object... values) {
1437        return bindList(EmptyHandling.THROW, key, values);
1438    }
1439
1440    /**
1441     * see {@link #bindList(BiConsumer, String, List)}
1442     *
1443     * @param onEmpty handler for null/empty vararg array
1444     * @param key     attribute name
1445     * @param values  vararg values that will be comma-spliced into the defined attribute value.
1446     * @return this
1447     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the vararg array is empty.
1448     * @see EmptyHandling
1449     */
1450    public final This bindList(BiConsumer<SqlStatement, String> onEmpty, String key, Object... values) {
1451        return bindList(onEmpty, key, values == null ? null : Arrays.asList(values));
1452    }
1453
1454    /**
1455     * see {@link #bindList(BiConsumer, String, List)}
1456     *
1457     * @param key    attribute name
1458     * @param values iterable values that will be comma-spliced into the defined attribute value.
1459     * @return this
1460     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the iterable is empty.
1461     */
1462    public final This bindList(String key, Iterable<?> values) {
1463        return bindList(EmptyHandling.THROW, key, values);
1464    }
1465
1466    /**
1467     * see {@link #bindList(BiConsumer, String, List)}
1468     *
1469     * @param onEmpty handler for null/empty list
1470     * @param key     attribute name
1471     * @param values  iterable values that will be comma-spliced into the defined attribute value.
1472     * @return this
1473     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the iterable is empty.
1474     * @see EmptyHandling
1475     */
1476    public final This bindList(BiConsumer<SqlStatement, String> onEmpty, String key, Iterable<?> values) {
1477        return bindList(onEmpty, key, values == null ? null : IterableLike.toList(values));
1478    }
1479
1480    /**
1481     * see {@link #bindList(BiConsumer, String, List)}
1482     *
1483     * @param key    attribute name
1484     * @param values iterator of values that will be comma-spliced into the defined attribute value.
1485     * @return this
1486     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the iterator is empty.
1487     */
1488    public final This bindList(String key, Iterator<?> values) {
1489        return bindList(EmptyHandling.THROW, key, values);
1490    }
1491
1492    /**
1493     * see {@link #bindList(BiConsumer, String, List)}
1494     *
1495     * @param onEmpty handler for null/empty list
1496     * @param key     attribute name
1497     * @param values  iterator of values that will be comma-spliced into the defined attribute value.
1498     * @return this
1499     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the iterator is empty.
1500     * @see EmptyHandling
1501     */
1502    public final This bindList(BiConsumer<SqlStatement, String> onEmpty, String key, Iterator<?> values) {
1503        return bindList(onEmpty, key, values == null ? null : IterableLike.toList(values));
1504    }
1505
1506    /**
1507     * Bind a parameter for each value in the given list, and defines an attribute as the comma-separated list of
1508     * parameter references (using colon prefix).
1509     * <p>
1510     * Examples:
1511     * <pre>
1512     * List&lt;String&gt; columnNames = Arrays.asList("id", "name", "created_on");
1513     * List&lt;Object&gt; values = Arrays.asList(1, "Alice", LocalDate.now());
1514     * handle.createUpdate("insert into things (&lt;columnNames&gt;) values (&lt;values&gt;)")
1515     *     .defineList("columnNames", columnNames)
1516     *     .bindList("values", values)
1517     *     .execute();
1518     *
1519     * List&lt;Integer&gt; ids = Arrays.asList(1, 2, 3);
1520     * List&lt;Thing&gt; things = handle.createQuery("select * from things where id in (&lt;ids&gt;)")
1521     *     .bindList("ids", ids)
1522     *     .mapTo(Contact.class)
1523     *     .list();
1524     * </pre>
1525     *
1526     * @param onEmpty handler for null/empty list
1527     * @param key     attribute name
1528     * @param values  list of values that will be comma-spliced into the defined attribute value.
1529     * @return this
1530     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the list is empty.
1531     * @see EmptyHandling
1532     */
1533    public final This bindList(BiConsumer<SqlStatement, String> onEmpty, String key, List<?> values) {
1534        if (values == null || values.isEmpty()) {
1535            onEmpty.accept(this, key);
1536            return typedThis;
1537        }
1538
1539        StringBuilder names = new StringBuilder();
1540
1541        for (int i = 0; i < values.size(); i++) {
1542            String name = "__" + key + "_" + i;
1543
1544            if (i > 0) {
1545                names.append(',');
1546            }
1547            String paramName = getConfig().get(SqlStatements.class).getSqlParser().nameParameter(name, getContext());
1548            names.append(paramName);
1549
1550            bind(name, values.get(i));
1551        }
1552
1553        return define(key, names.toString());
1554    }
1555
1556    /**
1557     * Bind a parameter for each value in the given list * number of property names,
1558     * and defines an attribute as the comma-separated list of parameter references (using colon prefix).
1559     *
1560     * Used to create query similar to:
1561     * select * from things where (id, foo) in ((1,'abc'),(2,'def'),(3,'ghi'))
1562     * <p>
1563     * Examples:
1564     * <pre>
1565     *
1566     * List&lt;ThingKey&gt; thingKeys = ...
1567     * List&lt;Thing&gt; things = handle.createQuery("select * from things where (id, foo) in (&lt;thingKeys&gt;)")
1568     *     .bindBeanList("thingKeys", thingKeys, Arrays.asList("id", "foo"))
1569     *     .mapTo(Contact.class)
1570     *     .list();
1571     * </pre>
1572     *
1573     * @param key    attribute name
1574     * @param values list of values that will be comma-spliced into the defined attribute value.
1575     * @param propertyNames list of properties that will be invoked on the values.
1576     * @return this
1577     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the list of values or properties is empty.
1578     * @throws UnableToCreateStatementException If a property can't be found on an value or we can't find a Argument for it.
1579     */
1580    public final This bindBeanList(String key, List<?> values, List<String> propertyNames) {
1581        if (values.isEmpty()) {
1582            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
1583                    getClass().getSimpleName() + ".bindBeanList was called with no values.");
1584        }
1585
1586        if (propertyNames.isEmpty()) {
1587            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
1588                    getClass().getSimpleName() + ".bindBeanList was called with no properties.");
1589        }
1590
1591        StringBuilder names = new StringBuilder();
1592
1593        StatementContext ctx = getContext();
1594        for (int valueIndex = 0; valueIndex < values.size(); valueIndex++) {
1595            if (valueIndex > 0) {
1596                names.append(',');
1597            }
1598
1599            Object bean = values.get(valueIndex);
1600            BeanPropertyArguments beanProperties = new BeanPropertyArguments(null, bean, getConfig());
1601
1602            names.append('(');
1603            for (int propertyIndex = 0; propertyIndex < propertyNames.size(); propertyIndex++) {
1604                if (propertyIndex > 0) {
1605                    names.append(',');
1606                }
1607                String propertyName = propertyNames.get(propertyIndex);
1608                String name = "__" + key + '_' + valueIndex + '_' + propertyName;
1609                names.append(':').append(name);
1610                Argument argument = beanProperties.find(propertyName, ctx)
1611                        .orElseThrow(() -> new UnableToCreateStatementException("Unable to get " + propertyName + " argument for " + bean, ctx));
1612                bind(name, argument);
1613            }
1614            names.append(')');
1615        }
1616
1617        return define(key, names.toString());
1618    }
1619
1620    /**
1621     * For each value given, create a tuple by invoking each given method in order, and bind the tuple into
1622     * a {@code VALUES (...)} format insert clause.
1623     * @param key attribute name
1624     * @param values list of values that will be comma-spliced into the defined attribute value
1625     * @param methodNames list of methods that will be invoked on the values
1626     * @return this
1627     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the list of values or properties is empty.
1628     * @throws UnableToCreateStatementException if the method cannot be found
1629     */
1630    public final This bindMethodsList(String key, Iterable<?> values, List<String> methodNames) {
1631        final Iterator<?> valueIter = values.iterator();
1632        if (!valueIter.hasNext()) {
1633            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
1634                getClass().getSimpleName() + ".bindMethodsList was called with no values.");
1635        }
1636
1637        if (methodNames.isEmpty()) {
1638            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
1639                getClass().getSimpleName() + ".bindMethodsList was called with no values.");
1640        }
1641
1642        final StringBuilder names = new StringBuilder();
1643        final StatementContext ctx = getContext();
1644        for (int valueIndex = 0; valueIter.hasNext(); valueIndex++) {
1645            if (valueIndex > 0) {
1646                names.append(',');
1647            }
1648
1649            final Object bean = valueIter.next();
1650            final ObjectMethodArguments beanMethods = new ObjectMethodArguments(null, bean);
1651
1652            names.append('(');
1653            for (int methodIndex = 0; methodIndex < methodNames.size(); methodIndex++) {
1654                if (methodIndex > 0) {
1655                    names.append(',');
1656                }
1657
1658                final String methodName = methodNames.get(methodIndex);
1659                final String name = key + valueIndex + '.' + methodName;
1660                names.append(':').append(name);
1661                final Argument argument = beanMethods.find(methodName, ctx)
1662                    .orElseThrow(() -> new UnableToCreateStatementException("Unable to get " + methodName + " argument for " + bean, ctx));
1663                bind(name, argument);
1664            }
1665            names.append(')');
1666        }
1667
1668        return define(key, names.toString());
1669    }
1670
1671    /**
1672     * Define an attribute as the comma-separated {@link String} from the elements of the {@code values} argument.
1673     * <p>
1674     * Examples:
1675     * <pre>
1676     * handle.createUpdate("insert into things (&lt;columnNames&gt;) values (&lt;values&gt;)")
1677     *     .defineList("columnNames", "id", "name", "created_on")
1678     *     .bindList("values", 1, "Alice", LocalDate.now())
1679     *     .execute();
1680     *
1681     * List&lt;Thing&gt; things = handle.createQuery("select &lt;columnNames&gt; from things")
1682     *     .bindList("columnNames", "id", "name", "created_on")
1683     *     .mapTo(Contact.class)
1684     *     .list();
1685     * </pre>
1686     *
1687     * @param key    attribute name
1688     * @param values vararg values that will be comma-spliced into the defined attribute value.
1689     * @return this
1690     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the vararg array is empty, or contains any null elements.
1691     */
1692    public final This defineList(String key, Object... values) {
1693        if (values.length == 0) {
1694            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
1695                    getClass().getSimpleName() + ".defineList was called with no vararg values.");
1696        }
1697        if (Stream.of(values).anyMatch(Objects::isNull)) {
1698            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
1699                    getClass().getSimpleName() + ".defineList was called with a vararg array containing null values.");
1700        }
1701
1702        return defineList(key, Arrays.asList(values));
1703    }
1704
1705    /**
1706     * Define an attribute as the comma-separated {@link String} from the elements of the {@code values} argument.
1707     * <p>
1708     * Examples:
1709     * <pre>
1710     * List&lt;String&gt; columnNames = Arrays.asList("id", "name", "created_on");
1711     * List&lt;Object&gt; values = Arrays.asList(1, "Alice", LocalDate.now());
1712     * handle.createUpdate("insert into things (&lt;columnNames&gt;) values (&lt;values&gt;)")
1713     *     .defineList("columnNames", columnNames)
1714     *     .bindList("values", 1, values)
1715     *     .execute();
1716     *
1717     * List&lt;String&gt; columnNames = Arrays.asList("id", "name", "created_on");
1718     * List&lt;Thing&gt; things = handle.createQuery("select &lt;columnNames&gt; from things")
1719     *     .bindList("columnNames", columnNames)
1720     *     .mapTo(Contact.class)
1721     *     .list();
1722     * </pre>
1723     *
1724     * @param key    attribute name
1725     * @param values list of values that will be comma-spliced into the defined attribute value.
1726     * @return this
1727     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the list is empty, or contains any null elements.
1728     */
1729    public final This defineList(String key, List<?> values) {
1730        if (values.isEmpty()) {
1731            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
1732                    getClass().getSimpleName() + ".defineList was called with an empty list.");
1733        }
1734        // Uses stream match, cause the Java 9 ImmutableList implementation throws an NPE if asked `contains(null)`
1735        if (values.stream().anyMatch(Objects::isNull)) {
1736            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
1737                    getClass().getSimpleName() + ".defineList was called with a list containing null values.");
1738        }
1739
1740        String value = values.stream()
1741                .map(Object::toString)
1742                .collect(joining(", "));
1743
1744        return define(key, value);
1745    }
1746
1747    /**
1748     * Define all bound arguments that don't already have a definition with a boolean indicating their presence.
1749     * Useful to easily template optional properties of pojos or beans like {@code <if(property)>property = :property<endif>}.
1750     * @return this
1751     */
1752    @Beta
1753    public This defineNamedBindings() {
1754        return addCustomizer(new DefineNamedBindingsStatementCustomizer());
1755    }
1756
1757    @Override
1758    public String toString() {
1759        return String.format("%s[sql=%s, bindings=%s]", getClass().getSimpleName(), sql, getContext().getBinding());
1760    }
1761
1762    PreparedStatement internalExecute() {
1763        final StatementContext ctx = getContext();
1764
1765        beforeTemplating();
1766
1767        ParsedSql parsedSql = parseSql();
1768
1769        try {
1770            stmt = createStatement(ctx, parsedSql);
1771            // The statement builder might (or might not) clean up the statement when called. E.g. the
1772            // caching statement builder relies on the statement *not* being closed.
1773            addCleanable(() -> handle.getStatementBuilder().close(handle.getConnection(), this.sql, stmt));
1774            getConfig(SqlStatements.class).customize(stmt);
1775        } catch (SQLException e) {
1776            throw new UnableToCreateStatementException(e, ctx);
1777        }
1778
1779        ctx.setStatement(stmt);
1780
1781        beforeBinding();
1782
1783        new ArgumentBinder(stmt, ctx, parsedSql.getParameters()).bind(getBinding());
1784
1785        beforeExecution();
1786
1787        try {
1788            SqlLoggerUtil.wrap(stmt::execute, ctx, getConfig(SqlStatements.class).getSqlLogger());
1789        } catch (SQLException e) {
1790            try {
1791                stmt.close();
1792            } catch (SQLException e1) {
1793                e.addSuppressed(e1);
1794            }
1795
1796            throw new UnableToExecuteStatementException(e, ctx);
1797        }
1798
1799        afterExecution();
1800
1801        return stmt;
1802    }
1803
1804    PreparedStatement createStatement(final StatementContext ctx, ParsedSql parsedSql) throws SQLException {
1805        return handle.getStatementBuilder().create(handle.getConnection(), parsedSql.getSql(), ctx);
1806    }
1807
1808    ParsedSql parseSql() {
1809        StatementContext ctx = getContext();
1810        SqlStatements statements = getConfig(SqlStatements.class);
1811
1812        String renderedSql = statements.preparedRender(sql, ctx);
1813        ctx.setRenderedSql(renderedSql);
1814
1815        ParsedSql parsedSql = statements.getSqlParser().parse(renderedSql, ctx);
1816        ctx.setParsedSql(parsedSql);
1817
1818        return parsedSql;
1819    }
1820
1821    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1822    <T> RowMapper<T> mapperForType(Class<T> type) {
1823        return (RowMapper<T>) mapperForType((Type) type);
1824    }
1825
1826    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1827    <T> RowMapper<T> mapperForType(GenericType<T> type) {
1828        return (RowMapper<T>) mapperForType(type.getType());
1829    }
1830
1831    RowMapper<?> mapperForType(Type type) {
1832        return getConfig(Mappers.class).findFor(type)
1833            .orElseThrow(() -> new UnsupportedOperationException("No mapper registered for " + type));
1834    }
1835
1836    void beforeTemplating() {
1837        callCustomizers(c -> c.beforeTemplating(stmt, getContext()));
1838    }
1839
1840    void beforeBinding() {
1841        callCustomizers(c -> c.beforeBinding(stmt, getContext()));
1842    }
1843
1844    void beforeExecution() {
1845        callCustomizers(c -> c.beforeExecution(stmt, getContext()));
1846    }
1847
1848    void afterExecution() {
1849        callCustomizers(c -> c.afterExecution(stmt, getContext()));
1850    }
1851}
